items.content_html:
This test your skills section requires some basic DOM and object knowledge. "Loops 2" in particular is the first time objects are mentioned in the learning material so to maintain difficulty consistency I felt it would help a learner to know that accessing data inside objects has different syntax from arrays. I'm also following along with the tutorial but had prior background knowledge from other languages; a pure beginner may otherwise find the omission confusing.

Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: Update index.html with info on objects

Anything else that could help us review it
I have not tried to verify this storage mechanism
items.title: Fixes #1451 by moving args/localvars outside the stack

items.content_html:
This is part of fixing #3196 - replaces a page inclusion macro of the EffectTiming dictionary properties into the two places it is used: Element.animate(), KeyframeEffect()

I would like to update further, perhaps as a post process. To help with that, answers to the following would be great.

  1. There is also KeyframeEffectReadOnly() that redirects to KeyframeEffect() and a AnimationEffectReadOnly which we don't document. I can't see in spec but they do appear in https://docs1.w3cub.com/haxe~javascript/html/animationeffectreadonly/ . Is it "valid" or are these things that no longer really exist?
  2. The EffectTiming dictionary should be removed altogether but I'm not quite sure how to deal with it:
    • The properties have sub-docs which I presume I can pull in most of. That would be painful but is doable.
    • What concerns me is that the thing has its own BCD https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EffectTiming#properties that is not included in the Element.animate() compatibility. I presume the action here is to update that with each of these options?
items.title: Pagemacro: include rather than transclude EffectTiming properties

items.content_html: changed the Card expiry date format which was eariler in "mm/dd/yyyy" to "=MM/YY".
items.title: update content/index.html

items.content_html:
Part of #7536.

This PR prepares the <dl> lists for Markdown. This was sometimes a bit tricky, so here a few notes for the reviewer:

  • There were cases where I just had to correct the html that was just wrong.
  • In many cases, they were several <dd>, I used <p> to achieve the same effect.
  • The more troublesome cases where when <ul> were embedded in the <dl>, which were rejected by the conversion script. In most cases the unsigned list was not a true list of items, but a way to split in paragraph. In these cases, I transformed it in paragraphs, rephrasing a bit to make it smooth.
  • In one case (X-Content-Type-Disposition), there was a whole <ul> that was bogus, taken from the next paragraph in the spec, mistakenly believed to apply there.
  • There were some <dd></dd> indicating missing documentation, I added a TBD in them, allowing them to be converted, and making them easy to find to document them in a future phase.
items.title: Fix dl in Web/HTTP to make them md-compatible

items.content_html: This PR fixes an incorrect heading hierarchy on the performance/how_long_is_too_long reference.
items.title: Incorrect heading hierarchy on `performance/how_long_is_too_long` reference

items.content_html:
Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

N/A

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

The previous version was mutating the first superclass's prototype (i.e. Object.getPrototypeOf(MyClass.prototype) returns SuperClass.prototype, and we don't want to mutate that).

Anything else that could help us review it

For what it's worth, this is a horrifically ugly pattern and should never be used (in my humble opinion), so I'd also be happy to just delete the whole section.
items.title: Fix mixin example in Object.assign

items.content_html:
The replacement code for "Simplifying list selectors" can use an :if as the last selector instead of having a comma-separated list of complex selectors.

If it's felt that we should show the 3 separate selectors for clarity, then I would suggest adding <p>Or even...</p> followed by the sorter code example.
